intro: Columnea zebrina, commonly known as the Zebra Columnea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and a distinct veining pattern. Columnea zebrina is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in bright, indirect light.
